skill.name: gwas-database
skill.description: Query NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog for SNP-trait associations. Search variants by rs ID, disease/trait, gene, retrieve p-values and summary statistics, for genetic epidemiology and polygenic risk scores.
skill.summary: Query NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog for SNP-trait associations. Search variants by rs ID, disease/trait, ge...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing no executable code. Only provides information about querying the public GWAS Catalog API with example patterns. No network calls, file access, or system modifications occur when this skill is installed.

content.user_title: Query GWAS Catalog for genetic associations
content.value_statement: Finding genetic associations for diseases requires navigating complex genomic databases. This skill provides clear guidance for querying the NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog to retrieve SNP-trait associations, p-values, and summary statistics for research.
actual_capabilities: Query SNP-trait associations by rs ID
Search genetic variants by disease or trait name
Find variants associated with specific genes
Access GWAS study metadata and publication details
Retrieve full summary statistics from deposited studies
limitations: Cannot download full summary statistics directly (requires FTP)
Only accesses NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog data
No local data storage or caching provided
Requires internet connection for API queries

use_cases.title: Identify disease variants
use_cases.description: Find all genetic variants associated with a specific disease or trait from published GWAS studies

use_cases.title: Variant annotation
use_cases.description: Look up rs IDs to retrieve genomic coordinates, trait associations, and effect sizes

use_cases.title: Polygenic risk assessment
use_cases.description: Identify variants for building polygenic risk scores for patient stratification

prompt_templates.title: Basic variant lookup
prompt_templates.scenario: Find associations for a genetic variant
prompt_templates.prompt: What traits and diseases are associated with rs7903146 in the GWAS Catalog? List all associations with their p-values and study information.

prompt_templates.title: Disease search
prompt_templates.scenario: Search for genetic associations by disease
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all genome-wide significant genetic variants (p < 5e-8) associated with type 2 diabetes from the GWAS Catalog. Include rs IDs and effect sizes.

prompt_templates.title: Gene-based search
prompt_templates.scenario: Find variants in a gene region
prompt_templates.prompt: What genetic variants in the TCF7L2 gene region are associated with any trait in the GWAS Catalog? Include genomic coordinates and p-values.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced query
prompt_templates.prompt: For variants rs7903146, rs1111875, and rs5186, retrieve all their trait associations from the GWAS Catalog. Create a summary table showing which traits each variant is associated with.

output_examples.input: What variants are associated with Parkinson disease in the GWAS Catalog?
output: Key genes: LRRK2, GBA, SNCA, MAPT

best_practices: Always check the p-value threshold (genome-wide significance is 5Ã—10â»â¸)
Review study ancestry information to assess population applicability
Cache API responses locally when performing iterative analyses
Cite the GWAS Catalog and original studies in publications
anti_patterns: Ignoring ancestry information when interpreting associations
Using nominal p-values without genome-wide significance thresholds
Combining effect sizes across studies without harmonization
Assuming GWAS Catalog contains all published associations

faq.question: Does this skill work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill is compatible with all three platforms and provides guidance for querying the GWAS Catalog API.

faq.question: What is the p-value threshold for genome-wide significance?
faq.answer: The standard threshold is p â‰¤ 5Ã—10â»â¸. This accounts for the multiple testing burden in GWAS.

faq.question: How do I access full summary statistics?
faq.answer: Full summary statistics are available via the separate Summary Statistics API or FTP download from ftp.ebi.ac.uk.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides documentation. All API queries go directly to EBI servers and no user data is stored.

faq.question: Why are some variants not found in the GWAS Catalog?
faq.answer: The catalog only includes curated associations from published studies meeting their inclusion criteria. Not all GWAS are included.

faq.question: How does this compare to dbSNP or gnomAD?
faq.answer: GWAS Catalog focuses on trait associations from published studies. dbSNP provides variant identifiers, gnomAD provides population frequencies.
